gravure.pygutenprint.sequence module¶

Module gravure.pygutenprint.sequence.

Curve code borrowed from GTK+, http://www.gtk.org/

class Sequence¶

Bases: builtins.object

Sequence(data=None, low=None, high=None, *args, **kwargs)

The Sequence is a simple vector of numbers data structure.

Parameters:
  • data – an optional python array like object to initialize the Sequence. if None the return Sequence will be empty.
  • low – a number to set the low boundary.
  • high – a number to set the high boundary.
Returns:

the newly created Sequence.
Raises:

MemmoryError.
copy(self)¶

Return a copy of this Sequence.

A new sequence will be created, and then the contents of self will be copied into it.

Returns:the new copy of the Sequence.
copy_in(self, dest)¶

Copy this Sequence in dest.

dest must be a valid Sequence previously instancied with dest = Sequence().

Parameters:dest – dest the destination Sequence.
create_reverse(self)¶

Return a reversed copy.

A new Sequence will be returned with the reverse contents of self being copied into it.

Returns:the new copy of the Sequence.
get_bounds(self)¶

Get the lower and upper bounds.

Returns:a tuple of floats bounds values, (min, max).
get_data(self)¶

Get acces to the data buffer for this sequence.

Returns:a Python memoryview.
get_float_data(self)¶

Get acces to the data in a sequence as float data buffer.

The memoryview returned is not guaranteed to be valid beyond the next non-const curve call; If the bounds of the curve exceed the limits of the data type, None is returned.

Returns:a read only Python memoryview or None
get_range(self)¶

Get range of values stored in the sequence.

Returns:a tuple of floats values (min, max).
max(self) → double¶

Get the max value stored in the sequence.

Returns:a float for the high bound.
memview¶

Property memview.

Returns:a python memoryview to access data buffer of the Sequence. Same as get_data().
min(self) → double¶

Get the min value stored in the sequence.

Returns:a float for the low bound.
nbytes¶

readonly property nbytes

Returns:The total length in bytes of the sequence buffer
reverse(self)¶

Reverse the sequence in place.

Note : this is a different behavior from the c implementation function. The c function stp_reverse() copy the reversed data in a destination structure without touching the source. The c api doesn’t provide in place function.

set_bounds(self, double low, double high)¶

Set the lower and upper bounds.

The lower and upper bounds set the minimum and maximum values that a point in the sequence may hold.

Parameters:
  • low – the float min value for the lower bound.
  • high – the float max value for the upper bound.
Raises:

ValueError if the lower bound is greater than

the upper bound.

set_data(self, data)¶

Set the data in a sequence.

Parameters:data – a python object implementing the buffer interface.
Raises:ValueError if None or with an array with a

not supported type.

set_size(self, size)¶

Set the sequence size.

The size is the number of elements the sequence contains. Note! : that resizing will destroy all data contained in the sequence.

Parameters:size – the size to set the sequence to.
Raises:MemmoryError.
shape¶

readonly property shape

Returns:a tuple with the sequence dimension.
size¶

readonly property size

Returns:The total number of element in the sequence
exception SequenceBoundsError¶

Bases: builtins.Exception

exception SequenceNaNError¶

Bases: builtins.Exception
